fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-4510].
  {panel}

Enter in some points
click elsewhere outside of the detail view
story points aren't saved
same goes for other inline edit fields
fields.summary: Inline edit fields do not save values when clicking/focusing outside of the detail view
As a user, I would like to be able to quickly filter issues out in Plan mode

fields.description:
- Must still be able to use classic stuff 
- Need some way to provide steps for labs guys as well (accordion in a tab perhaps) 
- Work with Rosie to get copy right
fields.summary: Make Scrum welcome tab as useful for labs users as it is for classic users

fields.description: We'll need to discuss this at length and work with [~rosie@atlassian.com] to do something that makes sense documentation and product wise
fields.summary: Remove the term Rapid Board, change Agile menu to list boards by name with icons, classic boards beneath?

fields.description: Totally clutters up the logs on Oracle.
fields.summary: Check all usages of AO Strings for null vs empty String. Oracle returns null. getText(null) throws warning Exceptions!

fields.description:
Similar to the Quick Filter selection I would like to be able to select which swimlanes to show.

Thank you.
Nick
fields.summary: As a PMM I would like the Rapid View Wallboard Gadget to allow me to select which Swimlanes I show so that I can build a tailored Wallboard
Delete swimlane dialog has screwed padding
column config mapping issue counts reflects global query, not work mode specific query

fields.description: When you have a lot of issues, it can be slow to load and it looks like nothing is happening.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to get visual feedback on the progress of Plan Mode's loading
DIY tab on Getting Started displays incorrect text for non-admin users
Error on create card dialog

fields.description: The idea is to create an atlassian-greenhopper.log so that GreenHopper errors are captured not only in atlassian-jira.log but also in atlassian-greenhopper.log
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to see greenhopper errors in its own log
The Manage Rapid Views screen points to an old Rapid View creation dialog. Can we please reuse the one from Getting Started, or automatically redirect there if there is no Views.

fields.description: Currently, I need to refresh the browser to see changes done by someone else (like moving a card to another column), it would be useful to see updates to my rapid board immediately (changes being pushed to my browser).
fields.summary: Agile board should refresh automatically whenever someone moves a card or makes another change

fields.description:
At the moment, the printing option in GreenHopper does not facilitate the printing of sub-tasks for an issue. If there is an issue with 5 sub-tasks, then printing the cards would only result in showing that one issue (without its sub-tasks).

Can the printing of cards feature be improved to facilitate this?
fields.summary: Ability to Print Sub-Tasks when Printing Cards

fields.description:
Due to an AO bug specific for Oracle,

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AO-297

we have to store one value of the rapid view in a PropertySet instead of the propert AO table. Once JIRA 5.0 is released and we only release against 5.0, we can move that data back into the AO table (implemented as an upgrade task) and subsequently remove the workaround code.
fields.summary: JIRA 5.0: Migrate Sprint Dates stored in PropertySet over to AO table (once GH is 5.0 only)

fields.description:
As a adminstrator of JIRA, 
When doing a single project import, 
JIRA needs to import all extra greenhopper version data 
so that my report data and graphs are not unuseable. 

Performing a single project import does not import green hopper aditional attributes on versions. Specically it does not respect the heirachy and the start/end/release dates on versions. 

This is very furstrating when importing a single project, as manually entering this data after the import is slow and painful (as you have to do it on the agile screen, as not all details are setable on the versions screen). Any extra custom data attributes used by plugins should be imported as some of this data is critical to the usefulness  of JIRA. 

The lack of this data ruins reports and graphs that can be obtained on the interface.
fields.summary: Import GreenHopper data as part of single project import

fields.description: In JIRA 5.0, Subtasks are in quick create. We should support this from the rapid board.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to create sub-tasks from the rapid board using quick create

fields.description: Would like to have a label to each non working days to describe what's the non working day is about.
fields.summary: Label/text to describe non working days
Edit Saved Filter is will not change

fields.description:
If you read the cog drop down in isolation, it reads like I'm working on Project entities here. I guess from the context I might know I'm not about to delete my project, but I imagine that this isn't the only rapid view named the same as the project it's viewing.

Adding a suffix of "Rapid View" might make it clearer what entity I'm manipulating here.
fields.summary: Make it clearer on the cog drop down what I'm [configur|copy|delet|creat]ing

fields.description: These buttons are tabs - only one can be active at a time. They should be treated as such visually, like the issue tab panels on the view issue page for example.
fields.summary: Plan / Work / Report are tabs. They should be given the same visual language as other tabs in JIRA.

fields.description: Chrome and FF on Linux. See Environment field for further details.
fields.summary: QuickFilters and Plan / Work / Report buttons don't look like buttons

fields.description:
COS: 
- Show date range on work and plan tabs
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to specify the end date of Sprint when I start it
As a user, I would like the basic keyboard shortcuts to work on the planning mode screen

fields.description: It'd be great to be able to choose from a field (field picker, user picker) as columns.  This would allow for project managers to quickly change issue fields from a visual perspective.  Example would be change assignee, or change priority.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to use from columns besides Status (ie. assignee)

fields.description:
- Reset marker to top of backlog when Sprint is started

SP: 2
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to think about the Sprint following the current sprint by dragging the disabled marker

fields.description:
This issue is specific to Google Chrome since it's the only Browser that has the feature to 'Open image in new tab'

Steps to reproduce:
* Go to Agile -> Chart Board -> Issue Burndown Chart
* Right click on the middle of the chart and select 'Open image in new tab'

The chart will be broken with the following exception:
!broken.png|thumbnail!

fields.summary: Open an 'Image in new tab' is broken in Google Chrome

fields.description: For the "Include Sub-tasks" checkbox, I would like to be able to set a default value for that checkbox that will persist between page views.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the ability to set a default state for the "Include Sub-Tasks" checkbox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-4417].
  {panel}

Since I can edit the "Original Estimate" field of each story/subtask any time during the sprint (like when estimating was done on story cards, and I'm entering the estimates the day after start of sprint), I would expect the sprint start endpoint of the guidline to reflect the total of all "Original Estimate" fields' CURRENT VALUES (not shouting; just emphasizing).

I just started a 90 point sprint, entering most estimates on day 2, but my guideline says it's a 2 point sprint, so it's useless.

(I disagree with other users who want the guidline to be the guideline for work remianing. I want to know where my original estimate guideline is, so I know how far off plan discovery has driven me, so I can adapt the depth of my work and my plan to hit the end date.)

Thanks! Great tool!
fields.summary: Guideline end point at Version Start Date should respect corrections made to "Original Estimate" field.
Anonymous Reporter shows up as "No Content" on Details View
Opening issue operation dialogs don't hide the loading spinner

fields.description:
Hi Team,

The drop down for Components and Versions on edit issue screen does not work when we go to Edit issue from Agile Taskboard.

This works fine when we open the issue from Issue Navigator and then goto Edit Issue Screen.

Works fine on Firefox
Does not work on Chrome and IE 8.
It works fine on IE8 without compatibility mode.


JIRA version 

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Components, Version drop down not working while editing the jira issue through Agile Task Board.
Inline editing the summary of an issue on the Plan mode detail view does not update the description on the card

fields.description:
- Fade out, link in box 

SP: 3
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to understand what has happened when I click Start sprint by having an obvious visual change in the screen

fields.description:
Due to an AO bug specific for Oracle,

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AO-297

we have to store one value of the rapid view in a PropertySet instead of the propert AO table. Once JIRA 5.0 is released and we only release against 5.0, we can move that data back into the AO table (implemented as an upgrade task) and subsequently remove the workaround code.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.4: Migrate Scrum Rapid View flag from AO to PropertySet

fields.description:
Due to an AO bug specific for Oracle,

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AO-297

we have to store one value of the rapid view in a PropertySet instead of the propert AO table. Once JIRA 5.0 is released and we only release against 5.0, we can move that data back into the AO table (implemented as an upgrade task) and subsequently remove the workaround code.
fields.summary: JIRA 5.0: Migrate Scrum Rapid View flag stored in PropertySet over to AO table (once GH is 5.0 only)

fields.description: For any kind of product that exposes issue tracker publicly to clients but also uses GreenHopper for internal development, hiding the Agile tab would be desirable.
fields.summary: Restrict GreenHoppers 'Create' RapidBoard to specific groups

fields.description:
Our Greenhopper documentation is not clear how the upgrade process works when an instance has multiple rank fields in place. 

This needs to be improved.
fields.summary: Improve the documentation of the upgrade process when multiple rank fields are in place

fields.description:
Could the following pages include some warning about the Oracle permission fix on upgrade as documented [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0+Upgrade+Notes#JIRA50UpgradeNotes-JIRAserversusingOracledatabases] to include the create triggers and create sequences permission.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Installation+and+Upgrade+Guide#GreenHopperInstallationandUpgradeGuide-UpgradingGreenHopper
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.8.4+Upgrade+Notes#GreenHopper584UpgradeNotes-UpgradingfromGreenHopper57xorearlier
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.8+Upgrade+Notes#GreenHopper58UpgradeNotes-UpgradingfromGreenHopper57xto58
fields.summary: GreenHopper upgrade to 5.8.x documentation to include warnings of Oracle DB permissions

fields.description:
COS: 
- Basic burndown, guideline, show burndown of story points at time change occured
- Does not need to box by day (i.e. can be continuous)
- Does not need to address scope change
- Show for current Sprint on Report tab

SP: 20
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to monitor sprint progress by viewing a burndown chart by Story Points
Watching or unwatching an issue causes full page reload

fields.description: Creating a new Kanban RB, either by creating a new Project or just the View, creates a view where the base query does not include the {{fixVersion}} clauses. This means that, when releasing from the RB, the issues which are released remain in view.
fields.summary: New Kanban RB is created without the necessary fixVersion clauses

fields.description:
Chrome only, works in IE9

Type into description tab of detail pane
hit enter to view spinner of death
fields.summary: Typing into description tab of detail pane broken

fields.description:
I think the date ranges used for CFD when picking *Custom* dates are not quite what I expected. See attached screenshots.

In the first screenshot, I have used "double click" on the mini-chart to select the meaningful whole range, which happens to be only data from today (20th Jan) because the instance is new. Yet the date selector up the top reads "21/Jan to 21/Jan". Clearly this is inaccurate - 21st Jan is in the future.

In the second screenshot, I have used the *Custom* date picker to select a range from 20/Jan to 21/Jan. This range returns no data, even though there clearly is data in that range.

It seems that the times go from midday to midday, instead of midnight to (almost) midnight.
fields.summary: CFD date ranges do not bring back expected results

fields.description:
# Go to a Rapid Board
# Select a quick filter
# Click 'Configure' from the cog
# Click 'Use Rapid View'

Notice that the quick filter you selected is no longer selected.

Also applies to which mode you are using (Report vs Work).
fields.summary: Clicking 'Use Rapid View' in Configuration screen of Rapid Board does not remember your state

fields.description:
# Go to a Rapid Board
# Click 'Configure' from the cog
# Watch the URL
fields.summary: URL used when clicking 'Configure' of Rapid Board contains typo 'columnms'

fields.description: Can disable Scrum while in the middle of a sprint and can continue using the boards. Can copy scrum boards ad infinitum to continue using Scrum despite disabling
fields.summary: Disabling Scrum for RapidBoard does not disallow usage of Scrum Boards

fields.description:
When viewing an issue through the Rapid Board issue quick view panel, one notices that the sort order for comments on the quick view panel (newest at top) is not the same as the ordinary sort order on the normal issue view (newest at bottom).

Esentially, we would like to control the sort order of the comments in the quick view panel in GH.
fields.summary: Option to sort comments on issue quick view panel on Rapid Boards in differing orders
Transient Error dialog when clicking Issue link on the planning tab
Exception happens when shift+clicking issues after making an issue disappear from current Rapid Board
Create sub task operation isn't performed inline (and doesn't use QC - not sure if that's possible though)
Plan detail still shows last issue selected when they are passed into a Sprint and no issues remain to be planned

fields.description:
It can be annoying that you have to slowly move your mouse inside the mini-chart in order to select a range of time that includes the edge of the chart (either the right or left edge).

This could be improved so that, when the mouse moves outside of the mini-chart and the mouse is still being held down, we just select the maximum value as the end of the range.
fields.summary: Improve the mini-chart behaviour when trying to select a range that includes the edge of the chart

fields.description:
Steps:
# Have a Scrum Rapid Board
# Have at least 3 issues in the backlog
# Put the first issue into the sprint marker
# Start the sprint
# In Plan Mode, re-rank the two remaining issues (swap them)
# In Work Mode, complete the sprint (issue in sprint is incomplete)

When you go back to Plan Mode, notice that the sprint marker is at the very top of the backlog, as opposed to being below the first issue in the backlog.
fields.summary: Ranking on Plan Mode after starting a sprint affects where the marker is placed when sprint is completed

fields.description: See attached screen capture
fields.summary: Plan Detail View does not reposition when I close the "success" notification at the top of a new Rapid Board

IE8 Win7
fields.summary: Exception: 'this.element' is null or an object -- after creating new issue with Quick Create with create another checkbox enabled then hitting escape
CFD hover information doesn't scale when lots of issues are present

fields.description:
Steps:
# Log in as a user who is not a project administrator
# Go to a Scrum Rapid Board's Plan Mode
# Put some issues into the sprint
# Try to start the sprint: \\
  *You receive an error saying you cannot because you don't have permissions.* (this is good)
# The Start Sprint button is now disabled
# If you try to move the Sprint Marker, when you 'drop', it disappears
# Reloading the page makes the sprint marker return
fields.summary: Non-project administrators get 'weird behaviour' with Scrum Plan Mode when trying to plan a sprint

fields.description:
Compute which projects are in the backlog. If you don't have Project Admin for all projects, then grey out the Start Sprint button.

Note that this is not a permission but a UI problem - the start sprint operation will fail with an error if the user clicks on the start sprint button.
fields.summary: If a user does not have permission to start a sprint, do not allow them to do so on Plan Mode.

fields.description: We fixed the same on default, fix needs to be ported onto 5.9-branch
fields.summary: Quick create on report tab finishes with endless spinner

fields.description:
Environment:
IE8 Win7

Also applies to vote and watch links.
fields.summary: Assign to me action performs a full page reload

fields.description: Happens on default and 5.0-branch, also on 5.9-branch
fields.summary: Create issue using QC where result is not visible, then rank -> js errors

fields.description:
Will need to pick a good visual treatment together, some samples are at: 

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHUX+-+Plan++Mode+Screens
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see the total Story point estimate for the sprint in the Sprint marker

fields.description:
Visual treatment as in 
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHUX+-+Plan++Mode+Screens
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to show the story point estimate on plan mode card and the work mode card for Scrum
Fix Rapid Board CSS on 5.0-branch: AUI-Layout v GH new design

fields.description:
Upgrading to a version with Scrum for RB adds a custom field, which is then missing from the index for all pre-existing issues. 
This requires a reindex to address.

To see the problem: start up from default (which imports the sample dataset) and create a scrum RB for PRO. The plan tab will be empty, even though there are loads of issues that should be there.
fields.summary: As a user I want the rapid board to tell me (both at the time of enabling the lab and from the Rapid Board itself) I need to reindex if scrum is not working

fields.description:
If the locale of the user (or the system) is not in English, the charts on the Rapid Board still render their x-axis labels using English month names.

Apparently, flot has the ability to do this, using a {{monthNames}} parameter to {{$.plot.formateDate}}.
fields.summary: Rapid Board charts do not translate the date values on x-axis into user's locale

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
# Create a new project
# Create one issue
# Create a new rapid view with Scrum preset
# Go to Plan Mode 
# Ensure that the sprint marker is above the one issue
# Try to "rank" the issue above the sprint marker

You will get an error.
fields.summary: Trying to "rank" a single issue into the "sprint marker" in Plan Mode causes an error

fields.description: Adding the ability to attach a screenshot while creating or editing a card would save a ton of time.  We currently have to create cards then attach screen by using the Jira issue screen.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot functionality when creating new cards.

fields.description:
The default sorting for issues on the task board appears to be by issue priority, but defaults to Ascending with no option to re-sort.

I'd like the option to sort by Descending, so that I can see my high priority bugs/tasks/whatever first.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to sort my issues in Descending order on the Task Board

fields.description: Using the rapid board, I can see some of my issues, but many of them are "hidden" for lack of a better word. See screenshot - it's like there's a big white "box" in the middle of the screen. Using JIRA 4.4.3 and GH 5.8.3, tested in Chrome and FF (newest of each) and on multiple machines.
fields.summary: GreenHopper Rapid Board does not display issues correctly

fields.description: Test quick edit/ create.
fields.summary: Create new studio release 5.9-aStudio-2
As a developer I want sub queries to be programmatic only

fields.description:
if the last selected column in the control chart filter actually has no statuses mapped to it, the CC shows wrong information.

suggestion: display a warning if the user has that kind of misconfiguration, or alternatively, don't allow it in the RB config at all
fields.summary: Control chart shows skewed data if columns have no statuses mapped

fields.description: I'd like to be able to close the twixie on a swimlane whilst midway through scrolling in that swimlane.
fields.summary: Ability to close swimlane twixie when midway through scrolling in a swimlane

fields.description:
In the GH version currently running on studio (5.7.5-studio), the "Welcome Mat" feature is broken due to a missing Javascript library from JIRA. 

When a user enables the RapidBoard and tries to access it for the first time, he'll see this exception:

============================

    Exception: soy is not defined
    Resource: /s/en_USxwj1fb/663/20/5.7.5-studio/_/download/batch/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid-welcome/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid-welcome.js
    Line: 11
fields.summary: Welcome Mat broken on Studio
Creating an issue from a non-work tab generates spinner from hell
Story point on detail view
Inline edit for text, text box and number field

fields.description:
COS
- Redesign of Issue Detail with head, main and tab divisions of content
-- Tabs are Details (initial default), Description, Comments (if > 0)
--- fyi future tab for attachments but out of scope for this story
- Plan mode and stretch for Work mode
- Tab should persist next time an issue is selected or mode changes
fields.summary: Tabbify Detail View
Show active sprint name on work mode or "no Sprint'

fields.description:
The control chart in the RapidBoard is very useful for interactive investigation of outliers and other cycle time issues. We would really like to be able to get at the underlying detail data for all of the displayed issues so that additional analysis can be applied in Excel.

Ideally this would be an export that included issue information, and then had a column for each displayed workflow state and the count of days in that state (as displayed in the hover over window for an issue in the RB control chart).
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to be able to export the cycle time data in the control chart

fields.description:
As a Rapid Board Administrator - I want to be able to set issue count constraint over multiple columns - So that I can set WIP for more than one column giving my team intensives to focus their efforts and helping to get stuff into production.

Explanation : When implementing Kanban, I would like to give my team intensives to focus their efforts and helping to get stuff into production, to clear the “Done” column and maximize the flow.


Having issue count constraint over more than one coulmn This will allow to "simulate" sub columns as shown in attached picture and described on page 42 here - http://www.infoq.com/minibooks/kanban-scrum-minibook
fields.summary: Issue Count Constraint over more that one Column

fields.description: When using the rapid board, is it possible to show the resolution on the card when they're in the done column? Would make it easier when walking the board during standup
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see the resolution on the card in the done column on the rapid board

fields.description:
The Swimlane AO entity has a query field that's String (255)
A query can easily grow beyond the limit and so the field should be refactored to use a CLOB instead.

This also causes issues migrating from pre-AO RapidBoards.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to enter a Swimlane query longer than 255 characters

fields.description:
Upgrade task 11 migrates the rapid board labs data from propertySets to the new AO tables. In case there is labs data around that cannot be migrated (like string fields longer than 255 chars), the upgrade task should log an error and skip that particular rapid view. It must not throw an exception.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3677
fields.summary: migration of labs rapid views should ignore invalid data

fields.description:
IMO it would be very useful if attachments in Rapid Board would be visible!
At the moment I don't see a bonfire screenshot!
fields.summary: The Rapid Board doesn't show a bonfire screenshot

fields.description:
At the moment I have to create some quick-filter for e.g. assignee = userx.
It would be very helpful to have a global Drop-Down-User-List or an option to define a drop-down-list for a rapid board.
fields.summary: Rapid-Board: Assigned-Filter
Keyboard shortcut to access RapidBoard from System Dashboard?

fields.description:
The specific scenario our team is running is that they are using statistics in the planning board to define capacity per team member. 

The team would like to set up a statistic per person (filter), because based on vacation, etc., different people have different capacity (expected aggregated value/ statistic in a number field) on the team per sprint/ iteration. 

At this time because the same, single statistic is applied to the board view, the team has to manually change the statistic per person (filter) to check their capacity using the statistic feature. Ideally, we could set up different statistics per field and associate them with a specific filter.
fields.summary: As a user, I can associate a statistics configuration to a filter in the planning board in order to view a specific statistic in context
As a user I would like the Quick Filters to less like Operations buttons so I can enjoy life
